intro: Erythronium americanum f. bachii, commonly known as the Bach's American dog's mercury, is a rare variant of the American dog's mercury. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States, characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has lance-shaped leaves with a prominent midrib. Its botanical features include a short rhizome and a single, erect stem bearing a cluster of white or pale yellow flowers. This form is distinguished by its unique floral structure and genetic variation from the typical species.
